permissions: Admins can update equipment movement requirements. Non-admin users can update requirements only for brokers they are members of.
side_effects: Updates the equipment movement requirement and updates related trip customer cost allocations after commit.
validation_notes: At least one attribute or relationship flag must be provided. origin-at-min and destination-at-max must be ISO 8601 timestamps. destination-at-max must be greater than origin-at-min when both are set. origin and destination must be different if both are set. inbound-requirement and outbound-requirement must reference the same equipment as the requirement. inbound_requirement_id and outbound_requirement_id must be unique if set. customer-explicit must be related to the broker. equipment, origin, and destination must be related to the broker. When related to a confirmed job production plan, equipment_id, broker_id, origin_id, destination_id, origin_at_min, destination_at_max, inbound_requirement_id, and outbound_requirement_id cannot be changed. --customer-explicit, --inbound-requirement, --outbound-requirement, --origin, and --destination can be cleared by passing an empty value.

flags.name: --customer-explicit
flags.description: Customer ID (explicit override, empty to clear)

flags.name: --inbound-requirement
flags.description: Inbound equipment requirement ID (empty to clear)

flags.name: --outbound-requirement
flags.description: Outbound equipment requirement ID (empty to clear)
